result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Anthony M. Sautner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Causing a Disturbance (Disorderly Conduct). This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:45 am - DA calls case and states appearances.  Defendant Anthony M. Sautner not in court.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the Price, County Of.  This is a motion to enter judgment of conviction.  Notice was sent.  Court grants motion by default.  11:00 am - DE now appears.  DA recalls case.  State withdraws motion.  Court orders previous order vacated.  DEJ extended for one year.  DA to prepare new order.

9:30 am - Defendant Anthony M. Sautner appeared in court. Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DA states agreement. DA moves to amend Ct. 2 to Price Co. Ordinance 403-3 Disorderly Conduct. Court questions DE regarding right to attorney. DE waives right to attorney.  DA certifies victims rights compliance. Court orders amendment of Ct. 2. DE pleads NO CONTEST to both charges.  Court accepts plea on Ct. 2 and finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC.    Court questions DE regarding the plea in Ct. 1.  DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Comments by parties. Comments and ruling by Court. Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC on Ct. 1 deferred for a period of 1 year. Adj. 9:52 am. 

Court imposes:
Ct. 1 - Deferred - 1 year.  See written order.
Ct. 2 - $295 forfeiture.  Payplan granted of $25 on or before 11-30-15 and $50/mo each month thereafter until paid in full or CO.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 10-29-2015 09:30 am

Defendant Anthony M. Sautner appeared in court. Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.   DE enters plea of NOT GUILTY to all counts.    Notice of right to attorney given to DE. Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.  Bond to continue.
State's
written consent for contact

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release. Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney. Defendant may not have contact with Savannah Walkup, unless there is written consent on file.

11:29 am - Plaintiff, District Attorney Mark T. Fuhr, in person. Defendant, in person, in custody. Case called, appearances and possible charges stated. Defendant's next court date is 08-18-15 at 10:00 am. Court gives defendant notice of right to attorney and victim/witness intimidation form. Court questions parties as to bond. DA states bond recommendation. Court grants DA 5 business days in which to file complaint. Adj. 11:31 am.
